subject: Relationships
title: Why Couples Fight About Dishes
description: A short lesson to help you apply Why Couples Fight About Dishes.

hook.text: The fight is never about the dishes. It's about respect, fairness, and feeling unseen.

buildup.text: Relationship therapists say 69% of conflicts are perpetual â€” meaning they never get fully resolved.

discovery.text: The real issue behind household arguments is usually an unspoken need: 'Do you value my effort?'

twist.text: Solving the dish problem doesn't fix anything. Acknowledging the feeling behind it changes everything.

climax.text: Most relationship fights are coded messages. Decoding them requires listening past the words.

punchline.text: It's never about the dishes. It's about being seen.
